title: Stray Dog Trapped In Net, Beaten Up For Entering An Upscale Residential Society In Noida
text:
Stray Dog Trapped In Net, Beaten Up For Entering An Upscale Residential Society In Noida

Stray Dog Trapped In Net, Beaten Up For Entering An Upscale Residential Society In Noida

An FIR has been registered against five people after a video of a stray dog being beaten up by two men went viral.

Abhishek Tiwari, who claims to be a local BJP functionary and four others were booked by the Sector 49 police under IPC Section 506 (criminal intimidation) and Section 11 of the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act on the complaint by animal rights activist Kaveri Rana.

BCCL/ REPRESENTATIONAL IMAGE

In the video shared by Kaveri, two people can be seen beating up a dog that is trapped inside a net.

⁦@TOINoida⁩ Video of man allegedly hitting dog trapped inside a net in Noida’s Hyde Park society goes viral, 6 including a booth-level BJP Incharge & president of apartment association booked for animal cruelty ⁦@noidapolice⁩ ⁦@dgpup⁩ ⁦@myogiadityanath⁩ pic.twitter.com/5FwriViZEq — Shikha Salaria (@ShikhaTOI) October 29, 2019

Don't Miss 13.2 K SHARES 18.4 K SHARES 11.4 K SHARES 2.1 K SHARES 5.1 K SHARES

Abhishek allegedly told Kaveri that the dog was beaten up as they wanted to evict it because of the rising number of dog bites in the society.

She, however, claimed that, so far there has not been a single case of dog bite confirmed from the society.

"These three dogs live in the basement as they are not allowed to be up in the society. Not allowing them to roam freely in the society is also against the law. But capturing beating and throwing or killing is the worst one can do as a human being," she said.

Kaveri alleged that after she fields the FIR, she has been receiving threatening calls from Abhishek.

She also claimed that ever since the FIR was filed the AOA is pressuring and threatening the dog feeders of the society.
description: An FIR has been registered against five people after a video of a stray dog being beaten up by two men went viral. Abhishek Tiwari, who claims to be a local BJP functionary and four others were booked by the Sector 49 police under IPC Section 506 (criminal intimidation) and Section 11 of the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act on the complaint by animal rights activist Kaveri Rana.
